text:
Speaking from experience:
Subtyping AbstractDataFrames is hard and undocumented.
And has only become harder.
I do not recommend.

We're planning on getting rid of our packages that subtype AbstractDataFrames 
And instead having types that hold a DataFrame and extra data (like column names for KeyedFrames.jl) and don't try to subtype it.
Just provide a way for the user to access the DataFrame behind manually.

Might be cool to make them still be tables though.

text: Ah, that's interesting to hear from experience. If possible, I think it'd be great if anyone remembers what the difficulties were in subtyping AbstractDataFrame. We've discussed in the context of Tables.jl having a "sub"-interface for in-memory table structures that would support more than just `Tables.columns`/`Tables.rows`, like indexing, random access, etc. I've always thought AbstractDataFrame might be the best home for that interface. But I admit I haven't dug into the details at all.
